website_summaries.verdict: The best budget dock line meant for lighter craft and general use when security is required.
pros: Bungee-style dock line makes it easy to control the tension and slack between the watercraft and dock
Helps to absorb shock and avoid major structural damage to the boat
cons: Bungee design doesn't offer as much tension as standard double-braided cords

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: These are great!! We'd seen another boater using these and thought we'd try them. I love how easy they are to use and it makes docking so easy now. The 4 ft size is perfect. They stretch to 5ft. But keeps our boat close enough to the dock it's easy to get in and out. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Quickest way to dock the boat
customer_reviews.text: These elastic ropes are awesome! We have used them two summers now and they provide convenience that you can’t get from a standard rope. Docking the boat involves slipping the looped end over a pole or cleat on the dock and that’s it. They’ve kept the boat tied up through storms. We recommended them to our friends and they are also big fans of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyla Bajorek

customer_reviews.title: TEST BEFORE USING!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered four Airhead dock lines to replace ones which had become weathered with age. Three are as ordered. One apparently had a manufacturing defect as one end came apart while I was attaching it to my boat. My advice to future purchasers would be to test them before depending on them to hold your boat or other item. Give them a strong tug before using them. If I had not discovered the problem upon installation, my boat might have been damaged later.
customer_reviews.author: rl807

customer_reviews.title: Change the knot to bowline knot
customer_reviews.text: Glad I read the reviews before I used on my ski ! Knots on ends were crappy.... I just read these reviews and changed the knot they used and used bowline knot and boom works like a charm..with bowline knot loops won't come loose !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Flores

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Dock-Line
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Super easy to use and seems durable. These have made docking/undocking my 17' boat a breeze. Not sure what other reviewers are talking about in regards to changing the knots; my set wasn't glued or knotted at all, but rather threaded into a single piece. Maybe they're redesigned the product?
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great time saver and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Really like these and they work great as long as you know the spacing on the cleats you're using. We use these on our dock where I could adjust the cleats for tension. If you were using these at a public dock, they might not work as well because you want them to stretch enough to add tension but not too much or too little so spacing of the cleats is essential.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pull up and dock on the go!
customer_reviews.text: The bungee ropes are working great for us right now. I can tell that we will need to replace them by next season though. These ropes work great for temporary docking, because they're so easy to use. We often pull up to a dock where there is a restaurant and they work great for that! We secure our boat to the pier with these, but we check on the boat regularly and are nearby.
customer_reviews.author: L. Shea

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but title should be changed.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and I can see multiple utility for it from tying two boat together to docking. Title says Airhead AHDL- 4 Bungee Dockline 4 Feet. So I bought thinking I would be receiving 4 which wasn't the case. in description it says : AIRHEAD Bungee Dock LINES absorb shock to boats. So Lines with an "S" means multiple... Just know that this is for a single cord. Would be a 5 star rating would have received all 4...
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I feel you're better off using a normal rope. I mean, these are convenient and quicker, but the boat moves around a lot. I get your bumpers are there to help with that, but the boat doesn't seem as secure as regular ropes. Maybe if the stretching ability had more resistance, they would work better. If you're trying to enter the boat from the dock is certainly moves around more, which could lead to an accidental fall in. They seem well made, but they don't work out like I had hoped they would.
customer_reviews.author: Jermey Moore

customer_reviews.title: Good product just needs some improvements.
customer_reviews.text: Used them a handful of times this summer on a 21 foot center console. They work well, but definitely need some durability enhancing. They are showing some premature wear and tear and some extreme fraying after only a dozen uses at most. The floats on them work well, but will fall off if you aren’t vigilant in keeping up with them.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: I destroyed them, but...
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair of these for my skis, but a really-bad (hurricane) storm rolled through before I had finished preparing. I used these straps to hold my floating docks when I lost a support in the storm. While I eventually did snap/ruin both of these, they were strong-enough, lasted just long-enough and gave enough elasticity that my floating docks ultimately survived the storm. Buying more today.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Love these, but they degrade too quickly.
customer_reviews.text: The outer sheath doesn't seem to be UV resistant, and the elastic could not handle the 20' boat floating off the dock. After a few months, all elasticity was lost. That said...I still bought a second pair. They are easy to use and look good until worn out. Good snubber while they last.
customer_reviews.author: The Tommasinis

customer_reviews.title: Good for as long as they will last.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because so the kids could tie the pontoon up a lot easier. It has been a total game changer. No more bad knots coming undone or too loose. There is spring to them which lets them come on and off easily but I have noticed that they are losing their ability to spring back. Only had them a couple months so far. I like the concept but may have to invest in a better quality set next year.
customer_reviews.author: kiera tibor

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, hard to use in reality
customer_reviews.text: If you docked at the same location every time, this would make more sense as you should be able to map out where it's needed. I never use these as they seem more complicated than your standard rope and knot, might be good if you had fenders up and wanted to lounge with another boat in the middle of the lake. Overall, no issues with durability of product.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Erdely

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for my aluminum bass boat
customer_reviews.text: I stored my boat in a slip for a bit and purchased two of these to hold it in place. Along with a couple of bumpers the bungee's held my boat perfectly. Super easy to take on and off and just the right give. Totally worth the price. These things are great. I had to chuckle as I looked around at other expensive ski boats to find many of them were using this bungee as well. Guess its not a secret!
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: if you have a jet ski get this
customer_reviews.text: i have 3 skis 2 Kawasaki stx 15f's and 1 wave-runner these work great and hassle free i see alot of people at the docks holding there skis or tieing up with regular rope these never get tangled and takes 30 seconds to hook your ski to the dock, i just keep them in the storage space under the handle bars fits great ive had them for a season now and no signs of wear will for sure buy again if i need more
customer_reviews.author: Kole

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sweet dockline upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Have used for a couple months now and there are 2 main benefits. First, they are small enough to stay out of the way when not in use. Second, they make it super easy to tie up for a minute at the ramp or fuel dock. I wouldn't use them for longer term parking, at least not yet. They don't seem like they will last forever, but if I get a couple of years out of them, they will be well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: coad

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product last month, advertised as quantity of 2. Total price $8.99. I liked the product so well I placed the same order this month, this time I got a quantity of 1 for $8.99, I thought I was getting 2. I looked at my latest order and it appears they've changed the product to a quantity of 1, but charge the same price as the previous order of 2. Pay attention.
customer_reviews.author: Luscruz

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 4' to 5.6' came in yesterday, I used them today, one on bow & one on stern, used one bumper in the center, it held the boat great, pleased with them, will see how they will last. Don't think they will last long if they were in sunshine all the time, I'm just using them for a couple of hours at a time. Any way they worked great on our 17'1" Sportsman. I will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: KEITH BRANHAM

customer_reviews.title: 2 Years Strong!
customer_reviews.text: I use these lines regularly to tie up my 23ft Bennington Tritoon. I always leave my primary dock lines at the dock and use these when out and about. They are extremely durable and very versatile. Been using the four I bought 2 years now and they are holding up great!
customer_reviews.author: TW|STED

customer_reviews.title: Makes docking easier...
customer_reviews.text: These docklines make docking so much easier. They seem rather sturdy and I have high hopes that they will hold up to some abuse. I do wish they had a bit stronger 'bungee' to them however to help keep the boat close to the dock in Oklahoma winds.
customer_reviews.author: S. Corrow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shock Absorbing Docklines
customer_reviews.text: The bungee docklines are fantastic. They are easy to use and actually do absorb shock between the dock cleat and our pontoon boat.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: These are great, so easy to dock.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. Perfect to dock your boat. Easy to use and attach . We loop ours around the post then attach to boat. They stretch nice and seem well made. Much better than tying dock ropes. Must have for easy docking.
customer_reviews.author: big lou

customer_reviews.title: Happy Boater
customer_reviews.text: In the last couple years I have bought about 10 of these! These are great for any boater!!! I just purchased more for a Christmas gift for a jet ski owner. I think they are more convenient than the conventional rope. There are no tying knots or worries that there isn't enough rope to tie to another boat/dock. They stretch and are easy to store. My only complaint is that over time they do tend to stretch and lose their elasticity but still can be used. Also another complaint is that they tend to come up "missing" because other boaters like them so much as well!!!
customer_reviews.author: krnd

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough good things about these. I had them attached to my runabout and a mountain lake for a month. They did absolutely perfect and Highwinds situation is keeping the cleats from ripping off of the boat or the dock. Very strong I have no problem trusting them with my boat
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for when I launch my boat alone. I can leave it at the dock while I park the vehicle and not worry about it coming undone while I'm gone. I am sure it would deteriorate if left out in the sun for long periods of time, but just right for what I needed and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: 70dave

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 day trip to Mark Twain Lake. Went crappie fishing and bought 2 Airhead Bungee to tie off as we were crappie fishing. Found the honey hole and tied my boat front and back to trees sticking out of the water. Boat stayed secure with little movement , Did I mention we slayed the crappie and managed to limit out 2 of the 3 days. I am going to purchase another pair for back up reserve. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Gaddis

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for rough/harsh dock environments/salt water uses
customer_reviews.text: This is nylon, and I think is better suited for lighter fresh water uses. In my case, my boat is a salt water boat and the dock cleats I use are too large for the loop on this. Also, I don't think this would wear very well on abrasive cleats. Not knocking it, as I can tell they put some thought into it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Kayak tow rope
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use as a tow rope and tie down with my kayaks. I used 2 of these looped to tow my 7 yr old in her small kayak behind me and it worked great. I have a few of them in different colors and they are stretchy and durable and work for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: AbbyValentine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product!!!! I absolutely love using them. I tie up in a covered boat slip and use 2 of these on the stern to keep the boat from getting dock rash. They are amazing in how well they hold and how they stretch enough to keep from breaking loose but not enough to hit the dock. I wish I would have bought them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Super product!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best! No more struggling with knots! Have used all summer and love them. Our boat with prevailing winds sits angled and these allow it it stay there. If they get weathered we will definitely buy more! So far, very durable and no signs of wear!
customer_reviews.author: Chick-a-dee

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: Great item and working very well with my 22 foot pontoon and dock. Living in North Central Arkansas we have a very extended boating season, April through November. Never ices over here so the boats stay in the water all year. These are really working well and holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Gunn

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for any boater! Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: These are a must-have for docking your boat and tying up to other boats on the water. These are easy to use and we use 4 of these on our tri-toon. Good quality hooks come with these. Keep in mind the actual size you will need to order to make them work the best when docking.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Chambers

customer_reviews.title: 10000% recommend
customer_reviews.text: If you have a jet ski and don't have one of these, add this to your Christmas list, I just leave it hooked to my eyelet by the steering column and let it dangle past my legs and it doesn't seem to get in the way. The strech that it has is very nice for areas with a lot of wakes
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good for very small boats and jetski
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 22 ft bay boat. They're not reliable for any boat over 16 ft in my opinion. Hence the four stars. Would be great for a jet ski maybe. Otherwise good quality and they stretch out to twice their resting length. And they float which could be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: fishfreak07

customer_reviews.title: No more hassles with ropes
customer_reviews.text: Have used this for over a year now and it is quick and convenience for both quick hookups on the dock and for lengthy ties ups . Have used frequently for over a year and still looks/acts brand new. It is handy to have and store and don't have to worry about the kids or pets getting tangled in any extra dock-line.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Darcy

customer_reviews.title: Great for what they are
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for a quick tie up to a cleat, but not ideal for tying to a piling or dock post bc the loop isn't big enough. I love the simplicity of these. Theyre great for popping into a waterside restaurant or gassing up at the marina. Easy and to use, just cannot use in all circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: erin redfield

customer_reviews.title: To small to put onto a dock kleet
customer_reviews.text: The reason why I gave it 2 stars is both sides are the same.. so one can hook up to the boat but the other side is to small To put on a kleet .. so can not use it
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Easy and effective
customer_reviews.text: Works gear, we have a heavy boat and 2 of these held our 25 ft cage haul really well to dock and go eat ect. Haven't used it overnight yet but stores much easier than long ropes
customer_reviews.author: Cherish

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for first time boater
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these Bungee's for our 16ft center console. There is no confusion on how to tie anything using these and even first time boaters have been helpful "first mates" when its time to dock. These are rigid enough that they keep the boat close to the dock but stretchy enough that any time a wake comes through it absorbs it. I only keep my boat in the water for a weekend at a time so I cannot comment on the long-term performance of these.
customer_reviews.author: Barry n' Pam

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead and buy them
customer_reviews.text: bought these for my bennington 22 ssrx sps and pleasantly surprised by the quality for the price. Super easy to use and sturdy. Will update in the future with long term use but for now I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: brandi

customer_reviews.title: I really like these
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what we do. Just keep them out of the sun when not in so they last longer. I would buy a couple extra just have on hand in case the bungee breaks.
customer_reviews.author: jshmoe

customer_reviews.title: These are GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I love these elastic mooring lines. They give and stretch with waves and dissipate much of the energy that would be transferred to your boat cleats. They are especially great for tying off to a T-Bar when stationary at a sand bar all day, as your boat can ride up and down with the waves and not pull all your anchorage off the bottom. Only down side is they tend to stretch a bit over a few years, and you may have to replace them if they lose elasticity or when the outer wound sheath starts to unravel. They come in a few various sizes t match your docking or mooring needs.
customer_reviews.author: Savage

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a little less springy. It's not heavy enough for my 28 ft boat. Would probably be best for a smaller boat. That being said it is well made and even though it's not large enough for my boat I still use it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Last dockline your ever gonna have
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with these dock lines. I trailer my boat so I can not vouch for long term docking situations but for daily outings A+! They are forgiving and WI built in loops you can look at anyone and say put the loop over the metal thingy and it gets done, no knots or long explanations. Will be buying for all watercraft.
customer_reviews.author: Mc'y T

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: This items works great and is good quality but I do not use it for any long term mooring just to get gas at the marina and other quick and easy docking needs
customer_reviews.author: KaraH

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware - they break easily - don’t waste your $
customer_reviews.text: I own a few and they work well but have broken very easily... used 3-4 times and it’s trash now. I contacted the manufacturer and they did not see to care about their product failure. I would recommend buying a better made product
customer_reviews.author: Brad&Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great, Simple solution to quickly tie off your boat to the dock
customer_reviews.text: Love the product, makes it easy for my family to secure the boat to our dock for quick stops or when we do not want to put the boat on the lift.
customer_reviews.author: MGoBlue16

customer_reviews.title: convenient but sunlight deteriorates them
customer_reviews.text: second set of these. convenient with built in bungee to tie up my boat to dock. sunlight and water deteriorate them after a season and need to buy another set
customer_reviews.author: twolfy

customer_reviews.title: Very simple, well made and helps keep my Basscat safe.
customer_reviews.text: You won't be sorry as this product is easy to use and fairly priced. Very cool idea.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan B.

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: We had our new bungee cords for one day. One cord popped off, came apart after installation on our pontoon. Not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with the quality. It just wasn't exactly what I needed. Will pass on to daughter to use with their jet skis- it might work for them better.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Rysavy

customer_reviews.title: Does it really fit most dock tie off
customer_reviews.text: It’s close but not yet the cigar! This product needs to fit most tie-off point, most are large not small, A carabiner would work on the ends better making it more universal to mooring up.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Confusing amount of Docklines.
customer_reviews.text: Your Catalog description indicates (4) 4ft Bungee Docklines. That's the way I understood it and I expected to receive (4) Docklines. But not !! So, I am in the process of ordering (1) more Dockline. I suggest your Catalog folks rewrite this item and clarify the amount of product the Customer is buying and will receive.
customer_reviews.author: George Allinger Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I hate the long ropes and can never quite tie it ...
customer_reviews.text: This makes securing your jetski so much easier! I hate the long ropes and can never quite tie it off correctly, so this makes it a breeze to jump off and tie off! Such a relief to be able to do it within seconds and not be standing there like an idiot haha I would 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Nice, quick and easy!
customer_reviews.text: These little guys are quick and easy! I wasn’t sure how well it would work with my boat (I have about a 20 foot boat), and I really hemmed and hawed over these- so nice so handy. Loop through cleat and off you go! I did have one dock that had eyelets instead of a cleat, threaded through that and off I went. I am getting another set for when I have slip and not just a dock.
customer_reviews.author: Deedee

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: We use these on our boat and they are so much easier than having to tie a rope. If we are just loading/unloading and need to stay by the dock, these are quick and easy to throw around a pole or cleat and they hold really well. They have just enough stretch to give with the waves and any rough wake that may come through. Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Very handy item in a kayak
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product of high quality. Works really well with my kayak. I can anchor to a dock or even a rock or tree branch to keep my spot while fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Svea Burska

customer_reviews.title: Must have for regular boaters
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these numerous times for many boats and for friends. The best boat rope for the money. Easy to use and last forever
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ropes to have on your boat!
customer_reviews.text: These cords are wonderful. For docking quick, connecting up on the water, or whatever. They are a must have for boaters.
customer_reviews.author: Drbotts

customer_reviews.title: Durable product!
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair on my boat for 4 years and still holding up. Couldn't resist getting another set for backup.
customer_reviews.author: D. Guest

customer_reviews.title: Stressless tie-up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, and secures your boat against bumper and dock with proper tension without stressing your cleats.
customer_reviews.author: T22

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these for the jetski! He uses this to tie up to bouys, docks, getting gas, etc. these are versatile and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: karla

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: They hold my boat to the dock every time I launch and I launch a lot so I put them through some use and they still hold the strength when I got them
customer_reviews.author: Braedyn T

customer_reviews.title: Failure caused thousands in damage.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 of these 2 years ago and one snapped and failed causing catostrophoc damage to my boat allowing it to bang into a neighboring dock. Destroying my fiberglass and new $2500 wrap. I would recommend these only for temporary securing your boat occasional weekend use and not left unattended for any extended time at a seasonal dock due to sun damage.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce W.

customer_reviews.title: Get two
customer_reviews.text: Work great and easy to use. They stretch a little which allows some movement of the boat while staying secured.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work great for my 24' pontoon boat
customer_reviews.text: These bungee docklines are a great product! They have a good elasticity to them and are built very solid. If you want your boat securely tied the dock, these may not be right for you, but I use them when getting gas at the lake or tying up to other boats and they are perfect. I have a 24' pontoon boat, so if they can hold this beast, they should do great for smaller boats.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Paul

customer_reviews.title: Using this with a large carabiner to bleed salmon on the side of the boat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to attach a very large carabiner to hold salmon before they go in the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M

customer_reviews.title: Allows the boat to move with the tide
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because we have a dock on the river, so we experience the rise and fall of the tide daily. When we leave the boat tied to the dock, because we are planning on going back out later, the bungees allow our boat to stay even on the water, and not tilted because I didn't leave enough slack in the rope.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Airhead bungee cord
customer_reviews.text: I like this product especially the clear sleeve that slides within the loop it snugs up stays where you place it .
customer_reviews.author: Christina Demming

customer_reviews.title: Nice for tying up PWC.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely stretchy and strong. I bought 2-4' lines. Wish I had one six and one 4. Two fours is a bit small for a STD PWC at the socks on our lake.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Berfel

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this bungee rope! We used it several times while docking our Wakesetter motor boat. We attached one side to a cleat on our boat and the other to the docks cleat. The pull string makes it easy and quick to attach "tie down." We also tied one end down on our boat and just pulled our boat onto its trailer without even having to step foot in the water. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Great for boat tie downs
customer_reviews.text: I use these as normal tie downs for my boat not just dock lines. They get mucky after a year and aren't very UV resistant. Need to be replaced each season.
customer_reviews.author: Adam J Smith

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: This is is a very weak product. Not enough tension to hold boat at dock properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: it's a bungee all right
customer_reviews.text: Works well, holds my boat to the dock. Does its job with no tying of ropes. Thumbs up from me.
customer_reviews.author: EthanAndLiamHD

customer_reviews.title: Great for boat
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these for a few years now... They work great to absorb alot of the shock. The sun does wear them out after 2 seasons, but still worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Wizzbert

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Got these to replace tying ropes at the dock. I have a 20 foot pontoon and these cords fit the cleats on my boat and dock perfectly. Tied a knot in it to make my boat a little more snug but still stretches enough to let it sway with the current on the inland lake she’s docked on.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Cisco

customer_reviews.title: Buy them.  You won't regreat it.  Get varying lengths to accommodate varying docks.
customer_reviews.text: I have a short and a long version for the front and rear of my ski respectively. These make launch/recovery super fast and convenient. The front strap I leave in my footwell, and the rear I double up on the tow hook, so they don't even get stored while trailering or while underway. Incredibly convenient. Couldn't recommend more. One important accessory for 5 minute launches and recovery times.
customer_reviews.author: H. Colwell

customer_reviews.title: Must have for waverunners
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy. I keep one in my waverunner and it's perfect for leaving it docked
customer_reviews.author: M.K. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Must Have!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for keeping your boat sturdy if you live on a river channel when water levels rise and fall. Keeps it just right where you want it with added buneed for water level changes
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Nice easy tie-ons!
customer_reviews.text: We used these bungee dockline tie-ons to keep our pontoon tied to the dock cleats. We also used them to tie our 3-person raft to the side of the pontoon for traveling on the river. Very sturdy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Throwing a line...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to my kayak, when launching from a floating dock. Very strongly made!
customer_reviews.author: Daryl J. Healey

customer_reviews.title: Bought for jet ski, nice stretch, color fades
customer_reviews.text: Nice tethering. Wouldn't recommend for long term tethering because elastic will Stretch and not return, but for short term tethering during windy days it's nice. Color fades pretty quick though.
customer_reviews.author: FD200

customer_reviews.title: So awesome
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine told me about this bungee dockline. He’s been using them for a few years now. I couldn’t believe how well it worked today and how versatile it is. Definitely ordering another one for the rear of the boat!
customer_reviews.author: G J M

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: Pretty straight forward product and easy to use. Compact and easy to store. Good to have.
customer_reviews.author: Halie Bidwell

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with these! They are significantly easier to use than a rope and they store well! They are excellent quality! I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CathrineES

customer_reviews.title: WORKS  GOOD
customer_reviews.text: SO FAR SO GOOD SEEMS TO WORK WELL, NICE STRETCH WITH THE WAVES WHEN AT DOCK
customer_reviews.author: PMK

customer_reviews.title: Great bungee line
customer_reviews.text: Definitely 4-5ft. We love this idea and have bought the 6-8ft line after using this for a week. Good bungee and it feels solid. We'll see after a season on material durability, but for now, awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the space saving
customer_reviews.text: I still keep rope in the boat, but these work great on the dock.
customer_reviews.author: JustAce2006

customer_reviews.title: once you buy a set you'll throw away all the other ropes you've been using
customer_reviews.text: these things are awesome - once you buy a set you'll throw away all the other ropes you've been using. Keeps the boat nice and centered in the dock slip and is the rope ends are the perfect size for all your boat and dock cleats.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nifty and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely convenient and well made. Perfect length for me.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is slick, I love it. Easy way to tether your boat to a dock post.
customer_reviews.author: Wonka

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and so much easier than a regular rope! I keep them in my boat for when I pull up to a dock thats not mine.
customer_reviews.author: DiDi

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with the way these Airheads work. I had used them successfully before building a new dock so set cleats on new dock so that Airheads were positioned for perfect fit to hold boat in slip.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: anchor bunjee
customer_reviews.text: Strength is awesome fir holding jet ski in shallow waters
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Letang

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This is the best for your buck in my opinion....Very durable and perfect size for a pwc.Very easy to use and it weighs nothing and doesn’t take up to much space
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Love these! One of the best purchases we made as far as boat accessories. Easy to use, we love them
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTINA MCCARL

customer_reviews.title: Great Dock Line!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect dock line. I love that is stretches a little but not too much. I like the shorter one for docking, it is the perfect length because there is a little room for movement, but it is still tight enough to stay in place and keep the boat close enough to jump on and off easily. They are very sturdy lines, I am impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: The best for Jet Ski
customer_reviews.text: These are high quality, thick, and relatively short so perfect for my jet ski. A bit pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Citi-Zen

customer_reviews.title: Must have for PWC
customer_reviews.text: Just got it so can’t speak for Durability but I really love the product. Easy to dock with my Jetski
customer_reviews.author: tara swierczynski

product_meta.title: AIRHEAD AHDL-4 Bungee Dockline 4 Feet
product_meta.description: AIRHEAD Bungee Dock Lines absorb shock to boats, cleats, docks, pylons and other hardware. The bungee cord is hidden inside the rope and acts as a built-in snubber. Two foam floats protect the boat from chafing. There’s a sliding adjustment at both ends for quick docking. Recommended for docking boats and PWC’s up to 4,000 pounds. Tensile strength is 2,150 pounds. Black/Blue/Red color scheme.
feature_bullets: Absorbs shock to boats, cleats, docks, pylons and other hardware
Bungee cord is hidden inside the rope and acts as a built-in snubber
Two foam floats protect the boat from chafing and sliding adjustment at both ends for quick docking
Recommended for docking boats and PWC's up to 4,000 pounds. Tensile strength is 2,150 pounds
4 feet in length, stretches to 5 1/2 feet

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
